# searchBarPlacementAllowsExternalIntegration

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether an alternate object may integrate the search bar somewhere other than the navigation bar or toolbar.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var searchBarPlacementAllowsExternalIntegration: Bool { get set }
```

## Overview

Set this value to indicate whether an object at a higher scope may take the search bar and integrate it somewhere other than the navigation bar (or toolbar) directly associated with this navigation item. [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController] uses this to allow Mac-like placement of the search bar on iPad. Defaults to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

Set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] to allow the containing [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController] to place the search bar in the navigation bar for the trailingmost column independent of the column used for this view controller. Ignored when [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/searchController] is `nil`, when [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/searchBarPlacement-swift.property] is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/SearchBarPlacement-swift.enum/stacked], or when not contained in a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController].

When the top view controller’s navigation item has this property set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] in more than one column at the same time, only one will be respected; the columns are checked in order of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController/Column/inspector], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController/Column/secondary], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController/Column/supplementary], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController/Column/primary]. If the search bar has a scope bar, the scope bar will not be moved into a different column.

## Integrating search into your interface

- **searchController**: The search controller to integrate into your navigation interface.
- **hidesSearchBarWhenScrolling**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the app hides the integrated search bar when scrolling any underlying content.
- **searchBarPlacement**: The placement of the search bar in the navigation bar.
- **preferredSearchBarPlacement**: The preferred placement of the search bar in the navigation bar.
- **UINavigationItem.SearchBarPlacement**: Constants that determine where the search bar appears in the navigation bar.
- **searchBarPlacementAllowsToolbarIntegration**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the system can place the search bar among other toolbar items on iPhone.
- **searchBarPlacementBarButtonItem**: An item you use to control the placement of the search bar in a toolbar on iPhone.
